bibl.title: Letter from Bertha L. Heilbron to Philip Showalter Hench, July 8, 1942

div1.p: Heilbron thanks Hench for the section of Wood's manuscript. She thinks that Wood did not cover the subject of Reed's service in Minnesota fully, and still intends to publish an article on that topic.

div1.head: Letter from Bertha L. Heilbron to Philip Showalter Hench, July 8, 1942
div1.opener:
Minnesota History
ARTHUR J. LARSEN, EDITOR
BERTHA L. HEILBRON, ASSISTANT EDITOR
MINNESOTA HISTORICAL SOCIETY
Saint Paul
July 8, 1942
Dr. Philip S. Hench
Mayo Clinic
Rochester, Minnesota
Dear Dr. Hench:
div1.p:
Thank you for letting us see Miss Wood's
manuscript. I am afraid that she has not done
much with the subject. We have much more material
here than she has used. Unless she raises some
objection, we still hope to publish a short state-
ment about Reed's Minnesota residence. I am
writing to Miss Wood to get her reaction. In
case we are able to publish, we shall be glad
to send you a copy of our note.

Many thanks for your co-operation in
this matter.
